com.foreach.across.core.revision

Interface RevisionBasedEntity<T extends RevisionBasedEntity>


  • public interface RevisionBasedEntity<T extends RevisionBasedEntity>
    Interface for entities that are related to a specificy Revision. A revision is an abstract concept only identified by a revision number, it is not necessary an entity in itself.

    A RevisionBasedEntity conceptually exists between one or more revisions. It has a revision where it starts and a revision where it ends.

    Author:
    Arne Vandamme

    • Method Detail

      • getEntityIdentifier

        Object getEntityIdentifier()
        The identifier of this entity that is the same across all revisions. This is used to match the different versions of an entity with each other.
        Returns:
        The identifier that will be used to match against existing entities.

      • getFirstRevision

        int getFirstRevision()
        Returns:
        First revision this entity was created.

      • setFirstRevision

        void setFirstRevision(int revision)

      • getRemovalRevision

        int getRemovalRevision()
        Returns:
        First revision in which this entity was NOT active.

      • setRemovalRevision

        void setRemovalRevision(int revision)

      • isDeleteForRevision

        boolean isDeleteForRevision()
        Special property used to determine if a draft entity is the "deleted version" of another entity. Meaning that upon the next checkin, the other entity will stop existing.
        Returns:
        True if this entity is the deleted version for a currently active one.

      • setDeleteForRevision

        void setDeleteForRevision(boolean deleted)

      • isDraft

        boolean isDraft()
        Returns:
        True if this entity is a draft, it does not have an official starting revision yet.

      • isDifferentVersionOf

        boolean isDifferentVersionOf(T other)
        Determine if this entity is different from the other entity. Where the other entity is expected to have the same identifier, but might be different on values. If this method returns true, it means a new version of the entity should be created.

        Note: conceptually not the same as the #equals(Object) method.

        Returns:
        True if this entity is different from the other version of the same entity.
